articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
Jim Craig done it all as a Celtic player. Jim and his team mates are the most famous Celtic players in Celtic’s long history after that famous win in Lisbon in 1967. On Sunday Jim Craig will unfurl the league flag at Paradise and get the hero’s welcome once again from the Celtic support. After […]
The post Jim Craig done it all as a CELTIC Player appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: Jim Craig done it all as a CELTIC Player

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
Last Saturday night I had the pleasure of sharing the stage with John Hartson in Maynooth to look back at last season, preview this season and also look back at John’s time at Celtic during a very successful time under Martin O’ Neill. A big thank you to North Kildare CSC for the invitation and […]

articles.title: JOHN HARSTON Season Preview & Golden Moments

articles.description:
The Ghirls kick off the 2024/25 campaign when Elena Sadiku’s title-winning side take on Dundee United at Celtic Park on Saturday, August 10. In yet another milestone for the history-making team, Celtic FC Women will unfurl the Champions’ flag for the first time in the SWPL, before kick-off at 1pm. Be there to show your […]

articles.title: GHIRLS IN GREEN

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
Hibs cutting Celtic’s allocation for the first away game of the season is more unwelcome news for Celtic fans. The allocation has been cut by just under 700 tickets which make it even harder now to nail down a ticket and push more Celtic fans into trying to get tickets to sit with Hibs fans. […]
The post Away Days Ticket Cut appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: Away Days Ticket Cut
